Diagnosis
	1. Gastric neuroendocrine carcinoma T2N1M0

	Date of diagnosis
	March 2024

	Treatment aim
	Curative

	Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

	Surgery
	15 Mar 2024 Diagnostic gastroscopy and biopsy

	Chemotherapy
	Not yet commenced

	Clinical studies
	None

	Current disease status
	Localized disease with regional nodal involvement

	Current issues
	Intermittent epigastric discomfort

	Summary of consultation
	This 62-year-old gentleman's case was discussed at today's Upper GI MDT. The diagnostic biopsy from 15/03/24 confirms a well-differentiated neuroendocrine carcinoma of the gastric body. Immunohistochemistry shows strong positivity for Chromogranin A and Synaptophysin. Ki-67 index is 12%. Staging CT chest/abdomen/pelvis demonstrates a 3.2cm gastric mass with two suspicious regional lymph nodes but no evidence of distant metastatic disease. Octreotide scan shows no evidence of other disease sites.

The MDT recommendations are for curative surgical management with total gastrectomy and D2 lymphadenectomy, followed by adjuvant platinum-based chemotherapy given the relatively high Ki-67 index. The case has been discussed with our NET-specialist medical oncologist [redacted name] who agrees with this approach.

	Further investigations
	Baseline Chromogranin A, 24-hour urinary 5-HIAA

	Medication prescribed
	PPI to continue

	Follow up
	Surgical clinic appointment next week for consent and pre-operative assessment

	Required GP actions
	None at present

	Summary of information given to the patient
	MDT outcome will be discussed in detail at surgical clinic appointment
